titles.title: To repeal and prohibit all privileges and gratuities for Members of the United States House of Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Makes it illegal to furnish any Member of the U.S. House of Representatives, at the expense of the Federal Government, free or at reduced costs: (1) medicine; (2) hospital care; (3) ambulance services; (4) meals; (5) flowers or plants; (6) pictures or picture frames; (7) haircuts; or (8) other items, services, or privileges, except official office expenses such as office supplies.
